meanings.sent1: The nosier cat always peeked through the window to see what was happening outside.
meanings.sent2: She became nosier as she grew older, always wanting to know more about everything.
meanings.sent3: The nosier squirrel kept trying to open the bird feeder to see what was inside.
meanings.sent4: Her nosier nature led her to discover the hidden compartment in the old desk.
meanings.sent5: The nosier puppy sniffed around the room, searching for hidden treats.

meanings.definition: someone who is overly curious or intrusive
meanings.sent1: The nosier in the neighborhood always knew everyone's business.
meanings.sent2: She was labeled as the nosier in the office due to her constant questioning.
meanings.sent3: The nosier at the party kept asking personal questions to strangers.
meanings.sent4: He was known as the nosier of the group, always poking his nose where it didn't belong.
meanings.sent5: The nosier was always the first to know the latest gossip in town.

meanings.definition: to be overly interested in the affairs of others
meanings.sent1: She nosiered around the office, trying to find out who was getting promoted.
meanings.sent2: He nosiers too much, always wanting to know what others are up to.
meanings.sent3: The kids nosiered about what their parents were planning for their surprise party.
meanings.sent4: She nosiered her way into the conversation, eager to hear the latest news.
meanings.sent5: They nosiered at the window, trying to catch a glimpse of the new neighbors.
